src:
Pliškova poslednja polufinalistkinja Šenžena
Čehinja bolja od Halep, a za finale sutra protiv Barti. Drugi par čine šampionka Svitolina i Benčič

01 Nov 2019

Poznate su sve četiri polufinalistkinje WTA finala u Šenženu, prestižnog turnira za pet najboljih tensierki u 2019. godini koji se igra za nagradni fond od 14 miliona dolara.
Poslednja se borbe za finale dokopala Karolina Pliškova. Čehinja je u napetom meču u Kini savladala nakon tri seta, rezultatom 6:0, 2:6 i 6:4 Rumunku Simonu Halep. Pliškovoj je ovo treće uzastopno polufinale na ovom turniru, ali nikad do sada nije uspela da se probije do borbe za titulu. Njena protivnica sutra će biti prva teniserka sveta, Australijanka Ešli Barti koja je juče pobedom na Petrom Kvitovom obezbedila plasman u nastavak takmičenja iz Crvene grupe.
Drugi polufinalni par čine Ukrajinka,inače aktuelna šampionka ovog takmičenja Elina Svitiolina, koja je slavila nad Amerikankom Sofijom Kenan sa 7:5 i 7:6 (10), i i Švajcarkinja Belinda Benčić kojoj je zbog povrede predala Holanđanka Kiki Bertens.

(Foto: Reuters)
text:
Plisk's last semi-finalist, Shenzhen
Czech better than Halep, and tomorrow's final against Barty. The other pair is champion Svitolina and Bencic

01 Nov 2019

All four semifinalists of the WTA Finals in Shenzhen are known, a prestigious tournament for the top five tensier women in 2019 playing for a prize pool of $ 14 million.
The last fight for the finals came from Karolina Pliskova. The Czechs defeated Romania's Simon Halep in a tense match in China after three sets, 6: 0, 2: 6 and 6: 4. Plushkov is the third consecutive semifinal in this tournament, but she has never been able to make it to the title fight. Her opponent tomorrow will be the world's first female tennis player, Ashley Barty, who secured a place in the Red Group Contest yesterday by winning Petar Kvitova.
The other semifinal pair is Ukrainian, otherwise current champion of this competition Elina Svitiolina, who celebrated over American Sophia Kenan with 7: 5 and 7: 6 (10), and also Switzerland's Belinda Bencic, who was handed over by Dutchwoman Kiki Bertens for her injury.

(Photo by Reuters)
